definition: to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon

sentences.english: Her achievement had crowds flinging confetti and chanting in Iraqi streets.
sentences.chinese: 她的成就使得伊拉克的羣衆在街上拋擲紙花，喊叫。

sentences.english: At first, e-mails were written on rocks and thrown at neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 起初，郵件是被刻在石頭上而後拋擲給鄰居們。

sentences.english: Another is to throw two prayer blocks that look like crescent moons.
sentences.chinese: 另一個方法則是拋擲兩個新月狀的筊杯。

sentences.english: All the people that love you, don't cast them aside.
sentences.chinese: 所有那些愛你的人，不要將他們拋擲一旁。

sentences.english: The sea is the inexorable social night into which the penal laws fling their condemned.
sentences.chinese: 海，就是冷酷無情的法律拋擲它犧牲品的總淵藪。
生活向我們拋擲弧線球。

sentences.english: Later the bride throws her bouquet of flowers to a group of single girls.
sentences.chinese: 稍後新娘向一堆單身女青年拋擲鮮花。

definition: to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
(literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
(bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
lit. the duck is the first to know if the spring water is warm (idiom)/fig. an expert in the field knows which way the wind blows
pinyin: chun1 jiang1 shui3 nuan3 ya1 xian1 zhi1
